greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers of the form (4k+1)*2^j which are not a sum of two squares.
comment: Intersection of A091072 and A022544. - _Robert Israel_, Oct 28 2018
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 42 is there because it's (4*5+1)*2^1 and is not a sum of two squares.
maple: filter:= proc(n) local w; w:= n/2^padic:-ordp(n,2);
w mod 4 = 1 and select(t -> t[2]::odd and t[1] mod 4 = 3, ifactors(w)[2]) <> []
results.author: _Alford Arnold_, Jun 03 2006
